title: Apigee - Running cert-manager in a custom namespace
abstract:
# Apigee - Running cert-manager in a custom namespace
You are currently viewing version 1.9 of the Apigee hybrid documentation. For more information, see [Supported versions](/apigee/docs/hybrid/supported-platforms#supported-versions) .
This topic explains how to specify a custom Kubernetes namespace for [cert-manager](https://cert-manager.io/) .
In most cases, cert-manager runs in the `cert-manager` namespace. Some users may have company policies restricting the creation of new Kubernetes namespaces or have policies requiring cert-manager to be run in a different namespace, for example `kube-system` .
content:
## Specify a custom namespace for cert-manager
- Create the namespace if needed:```
kubectl create namespace new-cert-manager-namespace
```
- Install cert-manager following the instructions in [Installation:  Introduction](https://cert-manager.io/v1.10-docs/installation/) in the cert-manager documentation. **Note:** You will have to edit the installation manifests to  install cert-manager in a custom namespace.
- Add a [certManager](/apigee/docs/hybrid/v1.9/config-prop-ref#certmanager) stanza to your  overrides file.```
certManager:
 namespace: new-cert-manager-namespace
 
```
- Apply the namespace change with`apigeectl init`:```
apigeectl init -f path-to-overrides.yaml
```
- Verify that cert-manager installed correctly in the new namespace with the`kubectl get pods`command:```
kubectl get pods -n new-cert-manager-namespace
``````
NAME          READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE
cert-manager-1234567-abcde    1/1  Running 0   21s
cert-manager-cainjector-23456789a-bcdef 1/1  Running 0   22s
cert-manager-webhook-3456789ab-cdef0  1/1  Running 0   20s
```
- If cert manager had previoiusly been running, delete the`cert-manager`instance in  the`cert-manager`namespace by following the instructions in [Uninstall  in the cert-manager documentation](https://cert-manager.io/docs/installation/kubectl/#uninstalling) .
